document.title: Physical Education Model Content Standards for California Public Schools, Kindergarten Through Grade Twelve

F76E2E90DFE301318EE968A86D17958E.description: Model support toward individuals of all ability levels and encourage others to be supportive and inclusive of all individuals.

F76DEC10DFE301318EE868A86D17958E.description: Describe leadership roles and responsibilities in the context of team games and activities.

F76DA650DFE301318EE768A86D17958E.description: Accept the roles of group members within the structure of a game or activity.

F76D1A70DFE301318EE568A86D17958E.description: Identify the contributions of members of a group or team and reward members for accomplishing a task or goal.

F76C90B0DFE301318EE368A86D17958E.description: Identify and evaluate three preferences for lifelong physical activity and determine one's responsibility for developing skills, acquiring knowledge of concepts, and achieving fitness.

F76C5380DFE301318EE268A86D17958E.description: Organize and work cooperatively with a group to achieve the goals of the group.

F76C1270DFE301318EE168A86D17958E.description: Abide by the decisions of the officials, accept the outcome of the game, and show appreciation toward participants.

F76B90D0DFE301318EDF68A86D17958E.description: Students demonstrate and utilize knowledge of psychological and sociological concepts, principles, and strategies that apply to the learning and performance of physical activity.

F76B3FB0DFE301318EDE68A86D17958E.description: Explain the different types of conditioning for different physical activities.

F76AEED0DFE301318EDD68A86D17958E.description: Explain the effects of nutrition and participation in physical activity on weight control, self-concept, and physical performance.

F76AAC00DFE301318EDC68A86D17958E.description: Identify and apply basic principles in weight/resistance training and safety practices.

F76A5A80DFE301318EDB68A86D17958E.description: Identify ways of increasing physical activity in routine daily activities.

F76A1300DFE301318EDA68A86D17958E.description: Identify appropriate physical activities that can be performed if one's physical fitness program is disrupted by inclement weather, travel from home or school, or a minor injury.

F769CCF0DFE301318ED968A86D17958E.description: Develop a two-week personal physical fitness plan specifying the proper warm-up and cool-down activities and the principles of exercise for each of the five components of health-related physical fitness.

F7697670DFE301318ED868A86D17958E.description: Students demonstrate knowledge of physical fitness concepts, principles, and strategies to improve health and performance.

F7691EB0DFE301318ED768A86D17958E.description: Participate safely in moderate to vigorous physical activity when conditions are atypical (weather, travel, injury).

F768D480DFE301318ED668A86D17958E.description: Assess periodically the attainment of, or progress toward, personal physical fitness goals and make necessary adjustments to a personal physical fitness program.

F7689550DFE301318ED568A86D17958E.description: Participate in moderate to vigorous physical activity a minimum of four days each week.

F76853F0DFE301318ED468A86D17958E.description: Plan and implement a two-week personal physical fitness plan in collaboration with the teacher.

F7680B60DFE301318ED368A86D17958E.description: Refine individual personal physical fitness goals for each of the five components of health-related physical fitness, using research-based criteria.

F767A950DFE301318ED268A86D17958E.description: Assess the components of health-related physical fitness (muscle strength, muscle endurance, aerobic capacity, flexibility, and body composition) by using a scientifically based health-related physical fitness assessment.

F7674A40DFE301318ED168A86D17958E.description: Students assess and maintain a level of physical fitness to improve health and performance.

F7670EF0DFE301318ED068A86D17958E.description: Develop and teach a team game that uses elements of spin or rebound, designated offensive and defensive space, a penalty system, and a scoring system.

F766D350DFE301318ECF68A86D17958E.description: Diagram, explain, and justify offensive and defensive strategies in modified and team sports, games, and activities.

F7669740DFE301318ECE68A86D17958E.description: Identify the characteristics of a highly skilled performance for the purpose of improving one's own performance.

F76658C0DFE301318ECD68A86D17958E.description: Combination of Movement Patterns and Skills

F7661830DFE301318ECC68A86D17958E.description: Explain how growth in height and weight affects performance and influences the selection of developmentally appropriate physical activities.

F765D420DFE301318ECB68A86D17958E.description: Explain the rotation principles used in performing various manipulative skills.

F7658990DFE301318ECA68A86D17958E.description: Describe and demonstrate how movement skills learned in one physical activity can be transferred and used to help learn another physical activity.

F7650A20DFE301318EC868A86D17958E.description: Students demonstrate knowledge of movement concepts, principles, and strategies that apply to the learning and performance of physical activities.

F764CAA0DFE301318EC768A86D17958E.description: Create and perform a routine using fundamental gymnastic/tumbling skills, locomotor and nonlocomotor movement patterns, and the elements of speed, direction, and level.

F7640EA0DFE301318EC568A86D17958E.description: Apply locomotor, nonlocomotor, and manipulative skills to team physical activities.

F763BFD0DFE301318EC468A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate basic offensive and defensive skills and strategies in team physical activities.

F7637790DFE301318EC368A86D17958E.description: Combinations of Movement Patterns and Skills

F7632A50DFE301318EC268A86D17958E.description: Create and perform a square dance.

F762DEC0DFE301318EC168A86D17958E.description: Identify and demonstrate square dance steps, positions, and patterns set to music.

F76239F0DFE301318EBF68A86D17958E.description: Students demonstrate the motor skills and movement patterns needed to perform a variety of physical activities.
